p: Stems (500 g) were hand-cut into small pieces (~2 cm) and hydrodistillated for 3 h in a Clevenger-type apparatus, using n-pentane as collection solvent [ 58]. The oil was dried by anhydrous sodium sulphate and stored at −30 °C until chemical analysis and pharmacological tests. The essential oil yield was 12.93 mg. To prepare the stock solution for biological studies 2 mg of essential oil were dissolved in 1 ml of dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO).
